attributes.comment:
I am in the process of adopting a little girl from Guatemala. My husband and I
have explored many options for starting our family and adoption is the choice that
calls to us. Adoption is an expensive road already, as well as being quite a roller
coaster ride in many ways. I feel that raising fees at USCIS for processes that
are required for our adoptions (and sometimes required twice if our process
streches out) by the drastic amount that is being proposed is simply not
honorable. I understand that everyone has their bridges to cross when starting a
family, but to ask us to pay 100+% increases for some of these processes is
unreasonable. Please reconsider the adjustment of the fees associated with
adoptive families and if you must raise these fess please be more prudent about
the percent of increase. Thank you for your time.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Adoptive Parent, Angela
